de.hohenheim.view.mobile

Class AnimationFigure

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.draw2d.Figure
      • de.hohenheim.view.mobile.AnimationFigure
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.draw2d.IFigure
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TrainFigure

    public abstract class AnimationFigure
extends org.eclipse.draw2d.Figure
    This class represents a Figure. To exist in the system a mobile object must be located in a RoomMap. This means either in a Room or on a Path between rooms. When the mobileFigure Object is instantiated, this Object must be located in a room, for example in the "entrance"-room of the RoomMap.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Arthur Kaul, Besim Gashi, Mathias Zwiesele, Daniel Intili, Bernd Hofs‰ﬂ

        java.lang.Object modellObject
        This is used if we want to add a modelObject to the figure. A modelObject can extend the viewpart with other information, for example for state informations, capacity and so on

      • setNode

        public void setNode(NodeFigure room)
        Setter method to set the room in which the mobile object is located in the moment. We must set the path to null when a room ist set. A mobile object can not be in a room and on a path.
        Parameters:
        NodeFigure - Sets the Room where the mobile object should be located actually.

      • setPath

        public void setPath(PathFigure on_path)
        Setter Method. Sets the path where a mobile object is actually located. --> Room is then set to null. A mobile object can be inside a room or on a path.
        Parameters:
        on_path -

      • walkTo

        public void walkTo(NodeMap map,
          NodeFigure room)
        An animation from the current position to a room. The mobile object must be in a room or on a path which is connected to the room it wants to go.
        Parameters:
        NodeMap - The RoomMap where the animation should be done.
        NodeFigure - The Room the mobile object shall go.

      • showBusy

        public void showBusy(boolean busy)
        Sets the busy indicator to true or false. This method is used by an animator, e.g. to draw a blinking rectangle which indicates if the figure is busy/waiting.
        Parameters:
        load -

      • isShowBusy

        public boolean isShowBusy()
        Returns the current state of the busy indicator. i.e. if the busyindicator is visible in the moment or not. This method is used by an animator, e.g. to draw a blinking rectangle which indicates if the figure is busy/waiting.
        Returns:
        boolean "isBusyRectangleVisible"
